meanings.definition: Capable of being worn away or destroyed by natural forces.
meanings.sent1: The erodable cliffs slowly crumbled into the sea.
meanings.sent2: The erodable soil washed away during the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The erodable sandcastle didn't stand a chance against the incoming tide.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was erodable, like a sandcastle under the relentless waves of frustration.
meanings.sent5: The erodable nature of the ice sculptures made them a temporary marvel.

meanings.sent1: Living near the erodable coastline, they knew the constant threat of erosion.
meanings.sent2: The erodable rocks along the riverbank showed signs of wear from the flowing water.
meanings.sent3: The erodable road seemed to shrink every time it rained.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was erodable, like the edges of a well-loved book.
meanings.sent5: The erodable cliffs stood as a reminder of the power of nature's gradual changes.

meanings.sent1: The erodable material quickly broke down under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The erodable paint on the old fence peeled off in the sun.
meanings.sent3: His erodable resolve weakened with each passing day.
meanings.sent4: The erodable memories faded like footprints in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The erodable structure crumbled under the weight of time.
